intro: Chascolytrum coarctatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved chascolytrum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, strap-like leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and a short, stout stem. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking floral display.
